department_name: Department of Architecture and Physical Planning

courses.name: Bachelor of Architecture
courses.description: This program provides education in architectural design, theory, and practice to prepare students for professional careers in architecture.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio I
course_units.description: Introduction to design principles and spatial concepts.

course_units.title: History of Architecture I
course_units.description: Survey of architectural history from ancient to medieval periods.

course_units.title: Building Materials and Construction I
course_units.description: Introduction to construction materials and basic construction methods.

course_units.title: Architectural Drawing
course_units.description: Techniques of architectural representation and drawing.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio II
course_units.description: Development of spatial concepts and design methodologies.

course_units.title: History of Architecture II
course_units.description: Architectural developments from Renaissance to modern era.

course_units.title: Building Materials and Construction II
course_units.description: Advanced construction materials and methods.

course_units.title: Computer Aided Design
course_units.description: Introduction to digital tools for architectural design.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio III
course_units.description: Intermediate design projects with emphasis on function and form.

course_units.title: Theory of Architecture I
course_units.description: Theoretical foundations of architectural design and criticism.

course_units.title: Structural Systems I
course_units.description: Basic principles of structural design in architecture.

course_units.title: Environmental Science in Architecture
course_units.description: Climate, comfort, and environmental considerations in building design.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio IV
course_units.description: Design projects focusing on context and site analysis.

course_units.title: Theory of Architecture II
course_units.description: Contemporary architectural theories and paradigms.

course_units.title: Structural Systems II
course_units.description: Advanced structural concepts and applications in architecture.

course_units.title: Building Services
course_units.description: Mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems in buildings.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio V
course_units.description: Complex design problems integrating multiple design considerations.

course_units.title: Urban Design and Planning
course_units.description: Principles and practices of urban design and city planning.

course_units.title: Building Technology
course_units.description: Integration of structural, mechanical, and construction systems.

course_units.title: Sustainable Design
course_units.description: Ecological approaches to architectural design.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio VI
course_units.description: Integration of technical systems with design concepts.

course_units.title: Professional Practice I
course_units.description: Introduction to architectural office practices and management.

course_units.title: Construction Economics
course_units.description: Cost estimation and economic considerations in architecture.

course_units.title: Research Methods in Architecture
course_units.description: Research methodologies for architectural inquiry.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio VII
course_units.description: Advanced design projects with focus on urban context.

course_units.title: Housing and Settlement Studies
course_units.description: Housing typologies and settlement patterns in various contexts.

course_units.title: Building Systems Integration
course_units.description: Comprehensive integration of building systems in design.

course_units.title: Architectural Conservation
course_units.description: Principles and practices of historic preservation.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio VIII
course_units.description: Comprehensive design project with technical integration.

course_units.title: Professional Practice II
course_units.description: Legal and ethical aspects of architectural practice.

course_units.title: Building Regulations and Codes
course_units.description: Building codes, standards, and regulatory frameworks.

course_units.title: Digital Fabrication
course_units.description: Advanced digital tools and fabrication methods in architecture.

course_units.title: Architectural Thesis I
course_units.description: Research and preliminary design for final thesis project.

course_units.title: Advanced Architectural Theory
course_units.description: Critical theories and philosophical considerations in architecture.

course_units.title: Professional Internship
course_units.description: Supervised practical experience in architectural practice.

course_units.title: Architectural Thesis II
course_units.description: Final thesis project demonstrating comprehensive architectural knowledge.

course_units.title: Project Management
course_units.description: Management of architectural projects from conception to completion.

course_units.title: Contemporary Issues in Architecture
course_units.description: Current debates and emerging trends in architectural practice.

courses.name: Bachelor of Physical Planning
courses.description: This program focuses on urban and regional planning, land use management, and sustainable development practices.

course_units.title: Introduction to Planning
course_units.description: Overview of physical planning theory and practice.

course_units.title: Planning History and Theory
course_units.description: Historical development of planning theories and approaches.

course_units.title: Planning Graphics and Communication
course_units.description: Visual communication techniques for planning proposals.

course_units.title: Introduction to GIS
course_units.description: Basic geographic information systems for planning applications.

course_units.title: Land Use Planning
course_units.description: Principles and practices of land use allocation and management.

course_units.title: Planning Methods and Techniques
course_units.description: Analytical methods for planning research and practice.

course_units.title: Social Aspects of Planning
course_units.description: Social factors and community considerations in planning.

course_units.title: Computer Applications in Planning
course_units.description: Digital tools and software for planning applications.

course_units.title: Urban Planning Studio I
course_units.description: Basic urban planning projects and design exercises.

course_units.title: Transportation Planning
course_units.description: Planning for transport systems and infrastructure.

course_units.title: Environmental Planning
course_units.description: Environmental considerations and impact assessment in planning.

course_units.title: Advanced GIS for Planning
course_units.description: Advanced spatial analysis techniques for planning applications.

course_units.title: Urban Planning Studio II
course_units.description: Intermediate urban planning projects with contextual analysis.

course_units.title: Housing and Settlement Planning
course_units.description: Planning for residential development and housing provision.

course_units.title: Planning Legislation and Governance
course_units.description: Legal frameworks and governance structures for planning.

course_units.title: Infrastructure Planning
course_units.description: Planning for urban services and utility systems.

course_units.title: Regional Planning Studio
course_units.description: Planning projects at regional and metropolitan scales.

course_units.title: Urban Economics
course_units.description: Economic principles and analysis in urban planning.

course_units.title: Sustainable Development
course_units.description: Planning for environmentally sustainable urban development.

course_units.title: Research Methods in Planning
course_units.description: Research design and methodologies for planning studies.

course_units.title: Detailed Planning Studio
course_units.description: Detailed site planning and urban design projects.

course_units.title: Urban Renewal and Regeneration
course_units.description: Planning for revitalization of existing urban areas.

course_units.title: Professional Practice in Planning
course_units.description: Professional ethics and practice in planning profession.

course_units.title: Planning in Developing Countries
course_units.description: Planning challenges and approaches in developing contexts.

course_units.title: Comprehensive Planning Studio
course_units.description: Integrated planning project addressing multiple systems.

course_units.title: Planning Theory Seminar
course_units.description: Advanced theories and contemporary debates in planning.

course_units.title: Climate Change and Planning
course_units.description: Planning responses to climate change challenges.

course_units.title: Research Proposal
course_units.description: Development of final year research proposal.

course_units.title: Final Year Project
course_units.description: Independent research project in physical planning.

course_units.title: Professional Internship
course_units.description: Supervised practical experience in planning practice.

course_units.title: Smart Cities and Innovation
course_units.description: Digital technologies and innovation in urban planning.

course_units.title: Planning Implementation Strategies
course_units.description: Approaches for implementing planning proposals.
